intro: Blumea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan Blumea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands, including New Guinea and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, often accompanied by narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Blumea papuana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitats.
